forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. Northeast wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 47. Southeast wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco unfolds under the gentle optimism of mostly sunny skies, as the chill of the day dances at a high near 55 degrees. A mild northeast breeze whispers through the streets, creating a fleeting sense of warmth that is soon outweighed by the promise of rain looming on the horizon. Observing the open vistas, one might note the clarity of the city; yet, towards the coast, there rests a subtle embrace of fog, a hallmark of this coastal locale that reminds us of nature's unpredictable temperament.

As evening descends, the skies will shift from their pleasant demeanor to a shroud of clouds, heralding a change. Expect rain to weave its way into the narrative around 10 PM, bringing with it the reassuring scent of wet earth and a low settling at 47 degrees. It’s wise to prepare for the inevitable embrace of moisture as temperature conditions flip from comfortable daylight to a cooler nightfall. For those lingering in the afternoon sun, a light jacket or layers would provide a gentle shield against the chill to come. Engaging with the day offers a moment to stroll through the neighborhoods, perhaps visiting a local café for a warm drink before the rain begins, capturing this serene city in transition as you bask in the moment's tranquility.
